result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua T Femrite was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 5-27-17; unpaid court obligations of $1,003 and supervision fees of $1,611.38

Judgment of Conviction mailed to defendant at N9027 Libke Rd, Cambria returned marked Not deliverable as addressed unable to forward.
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Sarbacker.

Defendant Joshua T Femrite in court, in custody with attorney Steven J Sarbacker.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard:  13CM244, 13CM106, and 14CF127.  Rights/Elements.  In case 13CM244 defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  3 yrs probation, $443.00 costs.  AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Successfully complete domestic violence counseling.  Dismiss but read in Ct. 2.  5 Days jail credit.   Case: 13CM106 defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  3 yrs. probation, AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Successfully complete domestic violence counseling.   $543.00 costs, including Domestic Violence surcharge.  Dismiss but read in Ct. 2.  5 days jail credit.   Case: 14CF127 Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 4, 5, & 6.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentence:  3 years probation each ct. AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Successfully complete domestic violence counseling.  Ct. 4 $443.00 costs/surcharge.  Ct. 5 $280.00 costs/surcharge.  Ct. 6 $280.00 costs/surcharge.   Dismiss but read in Cts.  1, 2, 3, &7.  66 Days jail credit.

Defendant Joshua T Femrite by video with attorney Steven J Sarbacker in the courtroom, motioned for bond reduction. Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin, objected to motion. Court denied motion.

standard felony conditions. Not possess any firearms.   Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with J.K., or residence or work place. May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings. Defendant Joshua T Femrite by video, in custody with attorney Amanda Kay Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions. Does not waive time limits.  Not possess any firearms.   Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with J.K., or residence or work place. May return 1x with law enforcement to get personal belongings. Not to be on any premises where alcohol is sold for on-site consumption. Must give new address in 24 hours of release.  Court appoints Atty Sarbacker to this case.
